intro: Pelexia quisqueyana, commonly known as the Quechua pelexia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
